items.description: The current language for the user's session. The final resolution of the following steps is stored here.
items.example:
# In any Python method
print(frappe.lang)  # Will print 'en', 'es', etc.

items.description: Priority 1 (highest): The `lang` parameter in the request URL.
Priority 2: The 'language' field in the logged-in user's document.
items.example:
# If user 'test@example.com' has 'English' in their settings
user_doc = frappe.get_doc('User', 'test@example.com')
# user_doc.language == 'en'

items.description: Priority 3: The default language configured for the entire instance.
items.example:
# Value in /app/system-settings
system_settings = frappe.get_doc('System Settings')
# system_settings.language == 'en'

items.description: Priority 4 (guests only): Cookie stored in the browser.
Priority 5 (guests only): Header from the browser.
